summary: The 'Ending the Cycle of Dependency Act of 2025' amends the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 and Title XIX of the Social Security Act (Medicaid). It modifies work requirements for SNAP (food stamps) recipients, increasing age limits for exemptions.  It also establishes work requirements for certain Medicaid recipients, outlining conditions for mandatory work, community service, or work program participation, and allowing states to disenroll individuals who do not meet those requirements.
